text:
Are there any plans to add an image/file/media picker to the CRM for custom objects?
This is not a deal breaker for a client â€“ but they are going to be super bummed when I tell them they have to copy the image url from the file manager and paste into the custom object form.
Would the file upload field type work?

Thanks to <@U0357GN74AZ>, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/128172-RevOps-Discussions/How-to-Upload-File-to-Property/td-p/413969|that question is answered here>
> The file property type is designed for forms only. It cannot be used by HubSpot CRM users to upload files.
That field just acts like a normal string/text field in the form :cry:
When you say form do you mean the internal form for creating/updating a custom object or an actual HubSpot form?
actual hs form. The internal crm form just acts like a text field
I've been able to get the file properties type to show up fine on normal HubSpot forms. This is a test file property for a custom object called cohorts
Custom object form. Focused field (Profile Image) has `"fieldType": "file"`

Oh yeah, that is the internal form for creating/updating custom objects. Normal HubSpot forms <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/marketing/forms> actually have a upload file button. But I agree with you internal forms should have capability to upload files. The problem with this thought is that how are you supposed to read which file is in the attached to the object?
